quote.content: Today, I am fortunate to have waken up. I am alive. I have a precious human life. I am not going to waste it. I am going to use all my energies to develop myself, to expand my heart out to others, to achieve enlightenment for the benefit of all beings.
quote.author: The Dalai Lama

quote.content: Perfection is achieved, not when there is nothing more to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
quote.author: Antoine de Saint-Exup√©ry

quote.content: You cannot dream yourself into a character; you must hammer and forge yourself into one.
quote.author: Henry David Thoreau

quote.content: All of us, even when we think we have noted every tiny detail, resort to pieces which have already been stated enough by others.
quote.author: W.G. Sebald

quote.content: Language is like a cracked kettle on which we beat out tunes for the bears to dance to, while all the time we long to move the stars to pity.
quote.author: Gustave Flaubert

quote.content: Amid the seeming confusion of our mysterious world, individuals are so nicely adjusted to a system, and systems to one another, and to a whole, that, by stepping aside for a moment, a man exposes himself to a fearful risk of losing his place forever. Like Wakefield, he may become, as it were, the Outcast of the Universe.
quote.author: Nathaniel Hawthorn

quote.content: I prefer nothing, unless it is true.
quote.author: Socrates

quote.content: For my part I deem those blessed to whom, by favour of the gods, it has been granted either to do what is worth writing of, or to write what is worth reading.
quote.author: Pliny the Younger

quote.content: All great and honorable actions are accompanied with great difficulties, and must be both enterprised and overcome with answerable courante.
quote.author: William Bradford

quote.content: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are. When you realize there is nothing lacking, the world belongs to you.
quote.author: Laozi

quote.content: And those who were seen dancing were thought to be insane by those who could not hear the music.
quote.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote.content: Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot.
quote.author: Neil Gaiman

quote.content: Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten.
quote.author: Neil Gaiman

quote.content: I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all kinds of things you can't from the center.
quote.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote.content: No, you do not have thousands of years to live. Urgency is on you. While you live, while you can, become good.
quote.author: Marcus Aurelius
